Source code for Playground.Python_Staff.OOP.example.example2_pizza.empoyees

[docs]class Employee:
    def __init__(self,name,salary = 0):
        self.name = name
        self.salary = salary


[docs]    def give_raise(self, precent):
        self.salary = self.salary + (self.salary * precent)



[docs]    def work(self):
        print(self.name, 'Doing staff')


    def __repr__(self):
        return '<Employee: name= %s, salary= %s>' % (self.name, self.salary)



[docs]class Chef(Employee):
    def __init__(self,name):
        Employee.__init__(self,name,5000)

[docs]    def work(self):
        print(self.name , 'Cooking food')




[docs]class Server(Employee):
    def __init__(self,name):
        Employee.__init__(self,name,40000)


[docs]    def work(self):
        print(self.name, 'Serving client')



[docs]class PizzaRobot(Chef):
    def __init__(self,name):
         Chef.__init__(self,name)


[docs]    def work(self):
        print(self.name,'Makeing pizza')


if __name__ == '__main__':
    bob = PizzaRobot('Robert')
    print(bob)
    bob.work()
    bob.give_raise(0.20)
    print(bob)

    for klass in Employee,Chef,Server,PizzaRobot:
        obj = klass(klass.__name__)
        obj.work()
